content:
As an AI language model, my knowledge is based on existing data and I do not have the ability to access up-to-date information. However, there is significant research taking place in various national parks in Namibia which is located in south-western Africa. 

Some current research and scientific studies that are being conducted in South West African national parks include:

1. Desert lion conservation project in the Skeleton Coast National Park in Namibia conducted by the Desert Lion Trust. The project aims to protect and conserve endangered desert lions and their habitats.

2. Research on the ecology and distribution of giraffes in the Etosha National Park in Namibia by the Giraffe Conservation Foundation. The study focuses on gathering data on individual giraffes’ movements, habitat utilization, and social behavior.

3. Rhino and elephant population monitoring in the Etosha National Park by the Namibian Ministry of Environment and Tourism. The study aims to gather information on the population dynamics of these two species and establish appropriate conservation measures to ensure their survival.

4. Study on the behavior and communication of spotted hyaenas in the Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park in Namibia conducted by the University of Pretoria. The study aims to provide insights into the behavior and social structure of these animals.

5. Research on the impact of climate change on vegetation and wildlife in the Sossusvlei area of the Namib-Naukluft National Park by the University of Namibia. The study focuses on how climate change is affecting the ecosystem and the survival of animals in this area.

These are just a few examples of the ongoing scientific research projects in South West African national parks.
